question.title: How would I go about looping back to the begining?

node.contents: Show us the code which resulted in an endless loop. Most likely you messed up your `Scanner` - e.g. by instantiating it multiple times inside the loop.

astNode.text: Show us the code which resulted in an endless loop. Most likely you messed up your `Scanner` - e.g. by instantiating it multiple times inside the loop.

node.contents: I'm trying to get it to where if the number is negative, it has you start over and input another number. I tried doing a while loop but it just put the system.out.println i had go into an endless loop.

astNode.text: I'm trying to get it to where if the number is negative, it has you start over and input another number. I tried doing a while loop but it just put the system.out.println i had go into an endless loop.

elements.contents: System.out.println("Please input a positive number: "); Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in); int num = scan.nextInt(); if (num < 0) { System.out.println("That number is negative."); } if (num >= 90 && num <= 110) { boolean value = true; } else if (num >= 190 && num <= 210) { boolean value = true; }

node.contents: That's exactly the same as I have, except his `if` statements are inside the `while` loop. Place them outside of it like I show. If you place them inside it will perform all the `if` statements before asking you to enter a positive number.

astNode.text: That's exactly the same as I have, except his `if` statements are inside the `while` loop. Place them outside of it like I show. If you place them inside it will perform all the `if` statements before asking you to enter a positive number.
